segments.text: 12, 1980 and Tommy Suarez of 5010 Oak Shadows is here and he's listening to everything that has been said.
Have you in any way been coerced into saying anything or you're saying this completely on your own?
It's my own free will.
It's my firm belief and has been since the day of the assassination in 1963.
Okay.
We can continue.
I just, I'm going to...

You were telling me yesterday that, and I can't remember because when I went back to the house I wrote some notes down but I couldn't remember all, there was something that you had said that had been deleted from the Warren Commission and all the other investigations.
The bulk of that investigation has been sealed.
And I believe at the time it was set at 80 years before it would ever be opened and displayed to the public.
And if you can believe what you see on television and read in the news and hear on radio, certain individuals who
believe there was more than one gunman involved and who have played back reported portions of the incident, some of which was supposed to have been recorded at Dallas Police Headquarters.
And their dispatching mechanism
tape because of the mobile unit's microphone on the motorcycle of one of the Dallas police officers who was riding escort that there was a

were shots fired and had been stipulated in the various reports and that some witnesses have claimed that there was a visual evidence to them of additional gunfire from a knoll long near the book storage building

I believe this knoll would have been a little bit southwest of the southwest corner of the building and would have been northwest of the path of the automobile the president and vice president were riding in.
I was watching this motorcade proceed through Dallas on television live at the time the assassination occurred.
But through that media, I was not able to hear anything that I could distinguish as a sound gunfire.
However, in the transfer from the Dallas police station to the
Dallas County Jail, which was attempted on Sunday morning.
Once again, I was watching that live on television and I did hear the report of firearms or a reasonable facsimile thereof at the incident that Jack Ruby surged towards Lee Harvey Oswald and
And Oswald folded over and grasped his midriff and then reportedly died, practically in the arms of a police captain.
And I did distinctly hear that police captain say, Jack, you son of a bitch.
To Jack Rutherford.
Is it common procedure for when they're escorting somebody for a policeman not to be in front of the person that they're escorting out?
Proper procedure for a police officer or anybody else to escort a prisoner is the party that has control of the prisoner walks behind the prisoner
But in this kind of situation that's transpired there, there was numerous peace officers of all categories there, all around Lee Harvey Austin.
And had it not been for the familiar sight of Jack Ruby around the Dallas police station over the period of
a couple, three months prior to this occurrence, Ruby would never have been able to even gotten on the ground.
I see, I see that.
And my question is, do you consider it to have been a proper procedure the way that they were escorting him out?
Nothing wrong with the procedure that they were using to escort him.
Their belief was that everybody had been okay to be there and screamed and with not any threat to life or the prisoner at all.
He was being properly escorted with the captain of the police
on one side of him and some other police official on the other side, a commissioned peace officer.
And they each had a hold of the arm.
That captain had a hold of Oswald's right arm and some other individual.
had his left arm, and they were walking the captain just barely to his right rear, almost the rest of him and the other officer in a similar position on the left side.
So it wasn't a matter of not having sufficient numbers of security.
And operating in a firm belief that they had screened everybody and that there was nobody that would be any threat to the prisoner present.
And I can't fault the Dallas Police Department on this thing at all.
But insofar as their method that they were using to transport it, that I would be somewhat tempted to criticize news media.

Because in the book that the chief of police at that time, Dallas, wrote on the subject, he was somewhat coerced by the news media, which can unseat just about any individual from any public office that they decide to, including any president of the United States.

with such action if he didn't have this thing in the daytime where the majority of people would be able to watch it going on on television live at the burst of between 2 and 4 o'clock a.m. when practically everybody had been in bed asleep and nobody must be watching it live on television.
Matter of fact, at that time, the local television stations here
Didn't even operate at that time of the morning.
Shut down.
Some of them don't nap.
Leave the area at 1 o'clock, 1.30.
And I don't think any of them stay all night.
Still have a shut down period sometimes.
Can you give me any information on this General Walker?
he spoke of earlier?
He was, after he had retired, he had become...
He retired from where?
From the military army.
He retired, I believe, a major general.
And was very active in the field of politics in the Democrat Party.
And I don't even recall what his first name initially was.
Okay.
But I refuse to concede the idea that Lee Martin Oswald was a spy for the Soviet Union, because a spy for the Soviet Union would not make a point of going
marry a Russian woman and bring her to live in Dallas, Texas.
He's trying to be a spy.
Give me a complete flop.
Because she didn't have his cover blown before he ever started.
And a spy with no cover is no spy.
They are gonna, you know, it's gonna...
it's going to bring attention at least to watch him and see what is going on.
Yeah.
I understand that by what I understand that's what you're saying.
He was supposed to have been under some kind of surveillance, but certainly wasn't under that close surveillance at that time.
They knew where he was.
They knew he was in Dallas somewhere.
They could undoubtedly have found him.
The problem seemed like to find his wife and family and all that after this thing happened.
They didn't?
They did.
Not only found them, but also found that he was the breadwinner for a place to live for he and his wife in Dallas.
They had been living in Fort Worth, his mother in Dallas, and vice versa.
He was keeping up both homes.
He wasn't even looking all this round to Mexico City and back.
He wasn't supposed to even have a job, period.
No way in the time that anybody knew that at all.
He was financing and living some kind of way.
And, of course, they claimed they checked this all out and that he had sufficient funds coming in from some source.
I never even know where to have done this all.
And it has never been...
clear in my mind what mode of transportation he used to get to Mexico City, but nobody ever mentioned that.
He drove down there, walked, hitchhiked.
How'd he got there?
On a bus?
He didn't go on a train, but he went across the river end at Roma if he had anything for a train to go to Roma about.
Nothing there.
We needed the transport on the train.
We didn't produce anything.
We walked the area around our little village there on the river.
Okay.
An old city on the opposite side of Mexico was the window town or whatever it was then.
The nearest place after you got over there was San Pedro and it was...
At that time, about the same size as Humber was at that time.
Which I wouldn't love it if you told me it was 1963.
Humber's a pretty good side of the town now, but it sure wasn't in 1963.
Well, you said that you served in the service from the years of... Could you repeat that again?
When I was in the military?
Right.
From August the 7th, 1940 to July 28th, 1945.
And what was your rank in the military?
Highest rank I held, and I was sergeant.
I did attend the officer candidate school and resigned out of it the day before I was to be commissioned as a personal agent.
You said that you know that, I don't know, that relations or something like that in Starr County.
Did you know somebody who lived in Starr County?
While I was stationed there, the only somebody that I ever knew there at that time, the city marshal there, a fellow by the name of Sanchez,
I was real well acquainted with him.
I knew him and talked to him a few times.
I know a lot of people there.
I know that the information has been that the great influx of recent years, the great influx of legal drugs of various kinds, marijuana, I don't know, hashish, heroin, a whole bag of tricks.
It was coming through there and some people built some awful pretty homes.
At least that's what they showed to be on the television out on the place that didn't produce anything.
They'd find homes out there anyway.
I don't know where they'd get their money from.
Oil there.
Great shakes for grazing cattle.
Probably that area right along there where those homes were.
Fifty acres might support a count.
Maybe.
And, of course, we never had any hard winter that would support them any time, support them year-round, but it takes so many acres to do it, and I doubt anybody had that many in that area.
There's a lot of very fine homes built all along that road, between them for several miles, right up to the edge of Star County.
towards the mission to the east of the city.
Showed these pictures and highway numbers and all this stuff right there.
Along the north of the road were the, what they called them, skeet specials.
Railroad tracks around the south of the highway.
These houses seemed to be all, practically all of them on the north side of the road.
Wasn't much of anything.
and certainly nothing but brush and that kind of stuff from there back to the banks of the Rio Grande.
Army post there, Fort Ringgold, sat right on the bank of the Rio Grande.
Can you tell me from the time that you started
and to your police career as to where you have been, you have worked for, for what police, for what police agencies you have worked for?
What police stations?
Since you have retired, since you got out of the military, have you always been to the police force?
Right.
And can you tell me what the police force...
I was discharged on a Friday, July the 28th, 1945.
And Monday morning, I went down and answered to an ad in the local paper and applied for a job at the Houston Police Department.
And on the 13th day of August...
I was called to the station and sworn in as a police officer and given an assignment to work the VJ day parade.
And so you have always said the police agency that you have always worked with has been HPD.
Have you ever...
seen any material any confidential material that is dealt with with any Kennedy related material without divulging any you know on any uh
written material or anything pertaining to this assassination?
That is not, that's not public.
No, okay.
We had nothing in our files.
I had access to any files we had.
And, uh, no, we had nothing to investigate.
To make any files, yeah.
As far as I know, other than the possibility that he may have passed through sometime, if Lee Harvey Osborn was ever in Houston, I don't know.
John Kennedy was here during that same period.
He was here when they were campaigning for the presidency and all, and then he was here
During that time, when Johnson was here, after he was president, I went out to Hobby Air Force and was part of the police security out there.
He and Lady Bird came down and he and Humphrey and his wife came with them.
You have told me that LBJ was not in the same car with Kennedy or Conley and that was perfect.
Kennedy and Conley was in the same car, but as the motorcades went by on television, there was a car they were in and then you would see the president lurch back like this in the seat.
And it seemed like John Conley lurched over this way at the same time and kind of down.
And Jackie Kennedy crawled over the back seat and back on the trunk of the open-top car and seemed to be trying to
do something for the president and the Secret Service.
Men were running along behind.
At least one of them climbed up on the trunk of the car.
And somebody gave some kind of signal and took off.
And they took off.
And there was the space between that car and the one that Johnson and Layward was in was...
Do you, is it your assumption that Conley, do you think that Conley and Kennedy were riding
Because Conley had more prestige than Johnson, and that it would be more of a good of an appearance for them to be riding together?
No, I think it was strictly a matter of protocol.
The chief executive of the nation visiting was a guest of the chief executive of the state, under the same token that the lieutenant governor.
would have been placed in a different car.
The two of them had gone to Washington to see the president.
That's something they drove around.
The governor and his wife was in the car with the president and his wife and the vice president.
I think it's just protocol on everything else.
Okay.
While in the military, did you receive any kind of commemorations in the military?
Like what?
Just anything.
Have you ever been given special work?
Decorations or anything.
Right.
Not particularly just theater and combat zone.
Decor and...
I did receive a certificate of appreciation from Half H. Arnold, the Commander General of the United States Air Force.
Okay.
And while you had been on the Houston Police Force, have you ever received any accommodations?
I mean, while you were on there, did you receive any kind of accommodations from the Houston Police Department?
Nothing more than letters of accommodation, a bunch of them, a tool of one kind.

um yesterday you said you had some uh some kind a whole wall full of uh there they are okay i i wouldn't i want to interrupt i'm going to interrupt this for that let me uh let me say this before we get this all that what i have stated here is my opinion and is uh the result of uh
my own investigation as best as I could go through with in this case.
But it appears to me that I have established a motive for each of the individuals that I have named as probable conspirators in this incident.
A motive of
of Lyndon Baines Johnson wanting to be President of the United States.
George Parr trying to repay Johnson for procuring presidential pardons for some 20 years of his life.
Lee Harvey Oswald, an opportunity of revenge against John Connolly and Jack Ruby, a strictly religious motivated him.
Okay.
Everything that you have said right now, we discussed yesterday, and I asked your permission if you would be recorded.
And nothing that we have said, nothing that has been said today has been pre-planned out to say
And you told me this yesterday that this has been your opinion.
And I've come up to you with no motive asking with no knowledge of my own.
And I'm just trying to find out.
I just want to learn your opinion.
Is that correct?
Right.
And I have expressed the same opinion for the same reasons to lots of people over the years.
I fully expect to express it to some more people.
Nobody ever promised me anything.
Tommy Suarez, this is Tommy Suarez, and he's been sitting here through the entire interview on both sides of the tapes, and he's listened to both sides of the tapes.
And have we stopped?
Have we stopped or have we edited anything in any way?
No.
No, I'm saying, have we stopped or have we edited anything?
No.
Okay, okay.
And right now, I'm going to cut this off because I want to go see what he was telling me about, about what you have on your wall.
And we'll resume the cinema.
You're lying, I'm sorry.
Everything that you said today, we've not deleted anything out of this tape, and...
I've taken pictures of the documents that I said I was going to take pictures of and we're now concluding the interview.
Is there anything left that you would like to say?
Nothing more than that I have formulated my opinion from the evidence that I had at hand and through application thereof to the

The rules of criminal investigation have arrived at the conclusion that the party's name herein is members of a conspiracy in the assassination of John Fitzgerald Kennedy, deceased former president of the United States of America.
would be the most logical of any people, and for the reasons herein stipulated, to have entered into a conspiracy, to have committed this offense.
Okay.
It's 5.40 p.m. on March the 12th, 1980, and the interview has been completed.
Today is March 13, 1980, and I'm just making this a follow-up note so that I don't forget on myself.

When I had spoken with the man the day before and I had talked to him earlier, he had said that Ruby had not enough control to outvote or at least to cause the redirect in certain policies or principles in the Dallas Police Station.
Special notes to check.
Why had Jack Ruby, whom was a strip joint operator, been so close to the Dallas Police Department?
Also, on my initial interview, which was not recorded, which was the day before this original recording, I had been told that Johnson had instructed the motorcade route to be changed and that
that mr excuse me from the interruption but that mr evans had been devoted this information by and that kennedy was only notified at the very last moment and was
The only reason that he went along with this is because Johnson said that Johnson had said or is reported to have conveniently talked him into that this change would be more politically profitable.

Special notes, which I'd like to make, just special notes, is Connolly's refusal to pardon Oswell, that Sanchez, who was the sheriff of Starr County, Coke Stevenson, Truman's pardon of par, Al Smith in 28, and it has not been mentioned, but it had been mentioned
by Conley that Kennedy's trip to Texas was dangerous.

Also, other points to note is why would Johnson accept the vice presidential nomination at the time he was Speaker at the House when the Speaker of the House is undisputedly considered to have more authority
or at least more of being in a position of persuasion if not his motives have been for more power.
Another point that I'd like to remember to investigate is did Ruby Clifton stop in between Mexico and why have none of the reports dealt with if he has or if he hasn't.
Also note
General Walker.
I want to find out more about him.
I was told, and I don't remember if this was on tape, that there was an attempt on his life.
A bullet hole went through his window and nearly missed him.
And this is publicly knowledge can be found in most periodicals.
One other part that wasn't recorded that I've seen in my notes

that parr is indebted to lbj for 10 years of his life or there was in in reference to that i suppose that the alleged assassination conspiracy would have wiped out the debt uh also i cannot recollect correctly but there was some mention about the gun about
Oswald's gun having not been in normal custody after his apprehension for a couple of hours.
These couple of hours are lagging time which are a point that needs to be investigated.
Nearly all the information on this tape is of course public knowledge and is the experience of one man who I consider to be of extremely high intelligence.
The fact that he has presented, he has presented well and he has at all times

adhered to his police mentality and police and prejudice and of using alleged and possible and probable and that certain things are not common procedure conclusion mr. John B Evans has granted me the right to use any and every part of this interview for my research
I realize that this interview does not bring to light any new evidence, but it does express some motives and circumstances that in my opinion deserve to be researched.
